AMD::detail::MatrixGrammar< Iterator > Struct Template Reference

#include <matrixgrammar.hpp>

Inheritance diagram for AMD::detail::MatrixGrammar< Iterator >:

Public Member Functions

 MatrixGrammar ()
 

Detailed Description

template<typename Iterator>
struct AMD::detail::MatrixGrammar< Iterator >

Parser that can iterate over a string of matrix expressions while skipping intermediary spaces and will create a tree of nodes representing the parsed matrix expression. Supports the following matrix operations: Addition(+) Subtraction(-) Multiplication(*) Division(/) Element-Wise Multiplication(o) Negation(-) Transpose(') Inverse(_) Trace (tr()) Log Determinant (lgdt())

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

template<typename Iterator >
AMD::detail::MatrixGrammar< Iterator >::MatrixGrammar ( )

The parser grammar is defined as follows: expression = term | term + term | term - term term = invtran | invtran * invtran | invtran / invtran invtran = factor' | factor_ | factor factor = qi::upper | qi::double | (expression) | -factor | +factor

< Rule corresponding to parsing one or more terms joined by binary

< Rule corresponding to parsing a potential binary op including

< Rule corresponding to parsing either an inv or transpose applied to

<Rule corresponding to parsing a literal, or a parenthetical expression

< Rule corresponding to parsing literals, ie Matrix like A, B, or a

< Code for debugging the grammar and seeing what was attempted
